Title: Relates to provision of interpreters at poll sites in certain cities
Summary: Requires the board of elections in cities with a population of one million or more to provide at least one interpreter for all languages that are designated city-wide languages at poll sites that contain an election district with at least fifty voting age residents whose limited English proficiency language is a designated city-wide language.
ActClause: AN ACT to amend the election law, in relation to provision of interpreters at poll sites in certain cities
